00001 #include "vnl_solve_qp.h"
00002 //:
00003 // \file
00004 // \brief Functions to solve various forms of constrained quadratic programming
00005 // \author  Tim Cootes

00007 #include <vnl/algo/vnl_svd.h>
00008 #include <vnl/algo/vnl_cholesky.h>

00013 //: Solve Sx=b for symmetric S
00014 static void vnl_solve_symmetric_le(const vnl_matrix<double>& S,
00015                                    const vnl_vector<double>& b,
00016                                    vnl_vector<double>& x)
00017 {
00018   vnl_cholesky chol(S,vnl_cholesky::estimate_condition);
00019   if (chol.rcond()>1e-8) x=chol.solve(b);
00020   else
00021   {
00022     vnl_svd<double> svd(S);
00023     x=svd.solve(b);
00024   }
00025 }
00026 
00027 //: Solve quadratic programming problem with linear constraints
00028 //  Minimise F(x)=0.5x'Hx + g'x  subject to Ax=b
00029 //  \param H Hessian of F(x) - must be symmetric
00030 //  \retval True if successful
00031 bool vnl_solve_qp_with_equality_constraints(const vnl_matrix<double>& H,
00032                                             const vnl_vector<double>& g,
00033                                             const vnl_matrix<double>& A,
00034                                             const vnl_vector<double>& b,
00035                                             vnl_vector<double>& x)
00036 {
00037   // Test inputs
00038   // unsigned n=H.rows();   // Number of unknowns
00039   unsigned nc=A.rows();  // Number of equality constraints
00040   assert(H.cols()==H.rows());
00041   assert(g.size()==H.rows());
00042   assert(A.cols()==H.rows());
00043   assert(b.size()==nc);
00044 
00045   vnl_matrix<double> H_inv;
00046   vnl_cholesky Hchol(H,vnl_cholesky::estimate_condition);
00047   if (Hchol.rcond()>1e-8) H_inv=Hchol.inverse();
00048   else
00049   {
00050     vnl_svd<double> Hsvd(H);
00051     H_inv=Hsvd.inverse();
00052   }
00053 
00054   if (nc==0)
00055   {
00056     // Unconstrained case
00057     x=-1.0*H_inv*g;
00058     return true;
00059   }
00060 
00061   vnl_vector<double> b1=(b+A*H_inv*g)*-1.0;
00062 
00063   // Solve for lagrange multipliers, lambda
00064   vnl_vector<double> lambda;  // Lagrange multipliers
00065   vnl_matrix<double> AHA = A*H_inv*A.transpose();
00066   vnl_solve_symmetric_le(AHA,b1,lambda);
00067 
00068   x=(H_inv*(g+A.transpose()*lambda))*-1.0;
00069   return true;
00070 }
00071 
00072 //: Solve quadratic programming problem with constraint sum(x)=0
00073 //  Minimise F(x)=0.5x'Hx + g'x  subject to sum(x)=0
00074 //  Special case of quadratic programming  (Equality constraint: x.1=0)
00075 //  \param H Hessian of F(x) - must be symmetric
00076 //  \retval True if successful
00077 bool vnl_solve_qp_zero_sum(const vnl_matrix<double>& H,
00078                            const vnl_vector<double>& g,
00079                            vnl_vector<double>& x)
00080 {
00081   // Test inputs
00082   // unsigned n=H.rows();   // Number of unknowns
00083   assert(H.cols()==H.rows());
00084   assert(g.size()==H.rows());
00085 
00086   vnl_matrix<double> H_inv;
00087   vnl_cholesky Hchol(H,vnl_cholesky::estimate_condition);
00088   if (Hchol.rcond()>1e-8) H_inv=Hchol.inverse();
00089   else
00090   {
00091     vnl_svd<double> Hsvd(H);
00092     H_inv=Hsvd.inverse();
00093   }
00094 
00095   double b1=-1.0*(H_inv*g).sum();
00096 
00097   // Sum of elements in H_inv  (= 1'*H_inv*1)
00098   double H_inv_sum = vnl_c_vector<double>::sum(H_inv.begin(),H_inv.size());
00099 
00100   if (vcl_fabs(H_inv_sum)<1e-8)
00101   {
00102     vcl_cerr<<"Uh-oh. H_inv.sum()="<<H_inv_sum<<vcl_endl
00103             <<"H="<<H<<vcl_endl
00104             <<"H_inv="<<H_inv<<vcl_endl;
00105   }
00106 
00107   // Solve for lagrange multiplier, lambda
00108   double lambda = b1/H_inv_sum;
00109 
00110   vnl_vector<double> g1(g);
00111   g1+=lambda;
00112 
00113   x=(H_inv*g1);
00114   x*=-1.0;
00115 
00116   return true;
00117 }
00118 
00119 //: Update x, checking inequality constraints and modifying valid where necessary
00120 static bool vnl_solve_qp_update_x(vnl_vector<double>& x,
00121                                   const vnl_vector<double>& x1,
00122                                   vnl_vector<double>& dx,
00123                                   vcl_vector<bool>& valid,
00124                                   unsigned& n_valid)
00125 {
00126   unsigned n=x.size();
00127   // Check non-negativity constraints
00128   int worst_i=-1;
00129   double min_alpha=1.0;
00130   for (unsigned i=0;i<n_valid;++i)
00131   {
00132     if (dx[i]<0.0)
00133     {
00134       double alpha = -1.0*x1[i]/dx[i];
00135       if (alpha<min_alpha)
00136       {
00137         min_alpha=alpha; worst_i=i;
00138       }
00139     }
00140   }
00141 
00142   // Update x and apply constraints
00143   unsigned i1=0;
00144   for (unsigned i=0;i<n;++i)
00145   {
00146     if (valid[i])
00147     {
00148       x[i]+=min_alpha*dx[i1];
00149       if (i1==(unsigned int)worst_i)
00150       {
00151         // Set this variable to zero and indicate it cannot change
00152         x[i]=0.0;
00153         valid[i]=false;
00154         n_valid--;
00155       }
00156       ++i1;
00157     }
00158   }
00159 
00160   return worst_i<0;
00161 }

00163 //: Solve unconstrained problem and apply one extra constraint if necessary
00164 //  Used by vnl_non_neg_constrained_qp
00165 //  Returns true if valid minimum found
00166 bool vnl_solve_qp_non_neg_step(const vnl_matrix<double>& H,
00167                                const vnl_vector<double>& g,
00168                                const vnl_matrix<double>& A,
00169                                const vnl_vector<double>& b,
00170                                vnl_vector<double>& x,
00171                                vcl_vector<bool>& valid,
00172                                unsigned& n_valid)
00173 {
00174   // Find solution to H1(x+dx)+g1=0, subject to A1(x1+dx)=b
00175   // H1,A1,g1,x1 contain subsets defined by valid array
00176   // ie solve H1.dx+(H1.x+g1)=0 subject to A1.dx=(b-A1.x1)
00177 
00178   unsigned n=H.rows();   // Full number of unknowns
00179   unsigned nc=A.rows();  // Number of equality constraints
00180 
00181   vnl_matrix<double> H1(n_valid,n_valid);
00182   vnl_matrix<double> A1(nc,n_valid);
00183   unsigned j1=0;
00184   for (unsigned j=0;j<n;++j)
00185   {
00186     if (valid[j])
00187     {
00188       // Fill column j1 of H with elements from column j of H
00189       // First from H:
00190       unsigned i1=0;
00191       for (unsigned i=0;i<n;++i)
00192       {
00193         if (valid[i]) { H1(i1,j1)=H(i,j); ++i1; }
00194       }
00195 
00196       // Now fill column of A1
00197       for (unsigned i=0;i<nc;++i,++i1) A1(i,j1)=A(i,j);
00198 
00199       ++j1;  // Move to next column in M
00200     }
00201   }
00202 
00203   vnl_vector<double> x1(n_valid);  // Will contain non-zero elements of x
00204   vnl_vector<double> g1(n_valid);
00205   unsigned i1=0;
00206   for (unsigned i=0;i<n;++i)
00207   {
00208     if (valid[i]) { g1[i1]=g[i]; x1[i1]=x[i]; ++i1; }
00209   }
00210   g1 += H1*x1;
00211 
00212   vnl_vector<double> b1(b);
00213   b1-= A1*x1;
00214 
00215   vnl_vector<double> dx(n_valid,0.0);
00216 
00217   vnl_solve_qp_with_equality_constraints(H1,g1,A1,b1,dx);
00218 
00219   // Update x, checking inequality constraints and modifying valid where necessary
00220   return vnl_solve_qp_update_x(x,x1,dx,valid,n_valid);
00221 }

00224 //: Solve unconstrained problem and apply one extra constraint if necessary
00225 //  Returns true if valid minimum found
00226 bool vnl_solve_qp_non_neg_sum_one_step(const vnl_matrix<double>& H,
00227                                        const vnl_vector<double>& g,
00228                                        vnl_vector<double>& x,
00229                                        vcl_vector<bool>& valid,
00230                                        unsigned& n_valid)
00231 {
00232   // Find solution to H1(x+dx)+g1=0, subject to sum(dx)=0.0
00233   // H1,g1,x1 contain subsets defined by valid array
00234   // ie solve H1.dx+(H1.x+g1)=0 subject to sum(dx)=0
00235 
00236   unsigned n=H.rows();   // Full number of unknowns
00237 
00238   vnl_matrix<double> H1(n_valid,n_valid);
00239   unsigned j1=0;
00240   for (unsigned j=0;j<n;++j)
00241   {
00242     if (valid[j])
00243     {
00244       // Fill column j1 of H with elements from column j of H
00245       // First from H:
00246       unsigned i1=0;
00247       for (unsigned i=0;i<n;++i)
00248       {
00249         if (valid[i]) { H1(i1,j1)=H(i,j); ++i1; }
00250       }
00251       ++j1;  // Move to next column in M
00252     }
00253   }
00254 
00255   vnl_vector<double> x1(n_valid);  // Will contain non-zero elements of x
00256   vnl_vector<double> g1(n_valid);
00257   unsigned i1=0;
00258   for (unsigned i=0;i<n;++i)
00259   {
00260     if (valid[i]) { g1[i1]=g[i]; x1[i1]=x[i]; ++i1; }
00261   }
00262   g1 += H1*x1;
00263 
00264   vnl_vector<double> dx(n_valid,0.0);
00265 
00266   vnl_solve_qp_zero_sum(H1,g1,dx);
00267 
00268   // Update x, checking inequality constraints and modifying valid where necessary
00269   return vnl_solve_qp_update_x(x,x1,dx,valid,n_valid);
00270 }

00273 //: Find non-negative solution to a constrained quadratic programming problem
00274 //  Minimise F(x)=0.5x'Hx + g'x  subject to Ax=b and x(i)>=0 for all i
00275 //
00276 //  Uses a variant of the active set strategy to solve the problem.
00277 //  This performs a sequence of unconstrained solutions.  If the inequality
00278 //  constraints are violated, the most violated x(i) is set to zero
00279 //  and a slightly smaller problem is solved.
00280 //  \param H Hessian of F(x) - must be symmetric
00281 //  \param x On input, it must satisfy all constraints (Ax=b, x(i)>=0)
00282 //  \param con_tol Tolerance for testing constraints:   |Ax-b|^2<con_tol
00283 //  \param verbose When true, output error messages to cerr if failed
00284 //  \retval True if successful
00285 bool vnl_solve_qp_with_non_neg_constraints(const vnl_matrix<double>& H,
00286                                            const vnl_vector<double>& g,
00287                                            const vnl_matrix<double>& A,
00288                                            const vnl_vector<double>& b,
00289                                            vnl_vector<double>& x,
00290                                            double con_tol,
00291                                            bool verbose)
00292 {
00293   // Test inputs
00294   unsigned n=H.rows();   // Number of unknowns
00295   //unsigned nc=A.rows();  // Number of equality constraints
00296   assert(H.cols()==n);
00297   assert(g.size()==n);
00298   assert(A.cols()==n);
00299   assert(b.size()==A.rows());
00300 
00301   if (vnl_vector_ssd(A*x,b)>con_tol)
00302   {
00303     if (verbose)
00304       vcl_cerr<<"Supplied x does not satisfy equality constraints\n";
00305     return false;
00306   }
00307   for (unsigned i=0;i<n;++i)
00308   {
00309     if (x[i]<0)
00310     {
00311       if (verbose)
00312         vcl_cerr<<"Element "<<i<<" of x is negative.  Must be >=0 on input.\n";
00313       return false;
00314     }
00315   }
00316 
00317   // Indicate which elements of x are non-zero and to be optimised
00318   vcl_vector<bool> valid(n,true);
00319   unsigned n_valid=n;
00320 
00321   while (!vnl_solve_qp_non_neg_step(H,g,A,b,x,valid,n_valid)) {}
00322 
00323   if (vnl_vector_ssd(A*x,b)>con_tol)
00324   {
00325     if (verbose)
00326       vcl_cerr<<"Oops: Final x does not satisfy equality constraints\n";
00327     return false;
00328   }
00329   else
00330     return true;
00331 }
00332 
00333 //: Find non-negative solution to a constrained quadratic programming problem
00334 //  Minimise F(x)=0.5x'Hx + g'x  subject to sum(x)=1 and x(i)>=0 for all i
00335 //
00336 //  Uses a variant of the active set strategy to solve the problem.
00337 //  This performs a sequence of unconstrained solutions.  If the inequality
00338 //  constraints are violated, the most violated x(i) is set to zero
00339 //  and a slightly smaller problem is solved.
00340 //  \param H Hessian of F(x) - must be symmetric
00341 //  \param x On input, it must satisfy all constraints (sum(x)=1, x(i)>=0)
00342 //  \param verbose When true, output error messages to cerr if failed
00343 //  \retval True if successful
00344 bool vnl_solve_qp_non_neg_sum_one(const vnl_matrix<double>& H,
00345                                   const vnl_vector<double>& g,
00346                                   vnl_vector<double>& x,
00347                                   bool verbose)
00348 {
00349   // Test inputs
00350   unsigned n=H.rows();   // Number of unknowns
00351   assert(H.cols()==n);
00352   assert(g.size()==n);
00353 
00354   if (vcl_fabs(x.sum()-1.0)>1e-8)
00355   {
00356     if (verbose)
00357       vcl_cerr<<"Supplied x does not sum to unity.\n";
00358     return false;
00359   }
00360   for (unsigned i=0;i<n;++i)
00361   {
00362     if (x[i]<0)
00363     {
00364       if (verbose)
00365         vcl_cerr<<"Element "<<i<<" of x is negative.  Must be >=0 on input.\n";
00366       return false;
00367     }
00368   }
00369 
00370   // Indicate which elements of x are non-zero and to be optimised
00371   vcl_vector<bool> valid(n,true);
00372   unsigned n_valid=n;
00373 
00374   while (!vnl_solve_qp_non_neg_sum_one_step(H,g,x,valid,n_valid)) {}
00375 
00376   if (vcl_fabs(x.sum()-1.0)>1e-8)
00377   {
00378     if (verbose)
00379       vcl_cerr<<"Oops. Final x does not sum to unity.\n";
00380     return false;
00381   }
00382   else
00383     return true;
00384 }
